cf.lukasheinzl.util

Class IO

  • java.lang.Object
    • cf.lukasheinzl.util.IO

  • public class IO
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a few IO utility methods.
    Author:
    Lukas Heinzl

    • Method Detail

      • writeZip

        public static void writeZip(java.nio.file.Path zip,
                            java.nio.file.Path root,
                            java.nio.file.Path... content)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used to compress multiple files into a single ZIP archive.
        Parameters:
        zip - The path to where to store the archive
        root - The path to the root of all files used (or null if the input files are not in one common sub-directory)
        content - The paths to the files to store in the archive
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the files were not found or the archive could not be created or written
        See Also:
        writeZip(Path, String[], byte[][])

      • writeZip

        public static void writeZip(java.nio.file.Path zip,
                            java.lang.String[] names,
                            byte[][] content)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used to store raw byte-data into a single ZIP archive.
        Parameters:
        zip - The path to where to store the archive
        names - The names of the individual data-packets (used for creating a file structure in the archive)
        content - The data-packets to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the archive could not be created or written

      • writeJar

        public static void writeJar(java.nio.file.Path jar,
                            java.lang.String mainClass,
                            java.nio.file.Path src,
                            java.nio.file.Path... content)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used to pack multiple files into a single JAR file.
        Parameters:
        jar - The path to where to store the JAR file
        mainClass - The full name (package + class name) of the main class
        src - The path to the root folder where all packages start from
        content - The paths to the files to store in the JAR file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the files were not found or the JAR file could not be created or written

      • writeJar

        public static void writeJar(java.nio.file.Path jar,
                            java.lang.String mainClass,
                            java.lang.String[] names,
                            byte[][] content)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used to store raw byte-data into a single JAR file.
        Parameters:
        jar - The path to where to store the JAR file
        mainClass - The full name (package + class name) of the main class
        names - The names of the individual data-packets (used for creating a file structure in the JAR file)
        content - The data-packets to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the JAR file could not be created or written

      • findFile

        public static java.io.File findFile(java.io.File root,
                                    java.lang.String name)
        This method can be used to search for files.
        Parameters:
        root - The root directory to start searching
        name - The name of the file to find
        Returns:
        The File or null if it could not be found

      • copyFiles

        public static void copyFiles(java.io.File src,
                             java.io.File dest)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method can be used to copy files and directories recursively.
        Parameters:
        src - The source file / directory
        dest - The destination file / directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the files could not be written

      • listFiles

        public static java.util.List<java.nio.file.Path> listFiles(java.nio.file.Path p)
        This method can be used to list all files recursively from the given path.
        Parameters:
        p - The path to start from
        Returns:
        A list of path containing all paths to the files found

      • deleteFiles

        public static void deleteFiles(java.io.File f)
        This method can be used to delete files and directories recursively.
        Parameters:
        f - The file to start the deletion from
